page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: PEOPLE LIVING IN THIS AREA DEPEND ON PRIVATE TRANSPORT. THERE IS ONE BUS A WEEK TO THE NEIGHBOURING TOWN ON MARKET DAY, BUT NON-FARMING MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY NEED A CAR TO GET TO THEIR PLACE OF WORK. FARMERS USE CONTRACTORS WITH LARGE TRANSPORTERS TO CARRY STOCK TO MARKET, BUT IF THERE ARE FEW ANIMALS FOR SALE THE LAND ROVER AND TRAILER ARE USED. THERE IS A PRIVATE ORGANISATION, RADNOR VALLEY TRAVEL CLUB, WITH MEMBERSHIP FEE OF 20P A YEAR. MEMBERSHIP GIVES ACCESS TO A BUS TO HEREFORD CITY ONCE A MONTH AND OTHER PLACES OF INTEREST, INCLUDING TRIPS TO THE EUROPEAN CONTINENT AND IRELAND. A BUS FROM THE MIDLANDS TO THE COAST IS AVAILABLE, BUT TO TRAVEL BY TRAIN INCURS A JOURNEY BY CAR OF 27 MILES, 15 MILES OR 12 MILES TO REACH BRITISH RAIL STATIONS.
